intro: Ruschia calcicola, commonly known as the limestone Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often on limestone outcrops. Its leaves are small, triangular, and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Ruschia calcicola produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and yellow, typically blooming in spring.
